snippet: Changes to immigration law are a harder sell to voters than gun control legislation, and the road to a consensus could be far bumpier than the narrative on Capitol Hill suggests.
abstract: Congressional Memo; Congress's inability to pass gun control legislation forewarns of similar difficulties in enacting immigration reform, despite broader Republican support for immigration overhaul.
lead_paragraph: Changes to immigration law are a harder sell to voters than gun control legislation, and the road to a consensus could be far bumpier than the narrative on Capitol Hill suggests.

headline.seo: Gun Legislation’s Failure Shadows Immigration Bill
headline.main: Failure of Gun Bill Casts Shadow on Immigration Reform
headline.print_headline: Gun Vote Clouds Path Of Immigration Bill
